content.title: rum.ts - lambda-cdk-infra

activitySummary: The user is actively engaged in writing code within the WebStorm IDE. The primary focus is on editing and managing dependencies in the 'package.json' files across different projects. The user is seen working on the 'lambda-cdk-infra' project, updating dependencies such as '@aws-sdk/client-cloudformation', '@aws-sdk/client-sts', and '@aws-sdk/credential-providers'. The user is also managing scripts for building and testing the project, indicating a focus on ensuring the project is correctly set up for development and deployment.

In another instance, the user is working on the 'xo-hiring-monorepo' project, again focusing on the 'package.json' file. The user is updating dependencies and scripts, including 'jest' for testing and 'ts-node' for running TypeScript files. The terminal output shows the user running 'npm audit' to check for vulnerabilities, indicating a focus on maintaining the security and integrity of the project dependencies.

The user is also seen navigating through various TypeScript files within the 'lambda-cdk-infra' project. Files such as 'cognito-seeding.ts' and 'rum.ts' are open, with the user examining and possibly editing the code. The code includes imports from AWS SDKs and CDK libraries, suggesting the user is working on infrastructure as code (IaC) for AWS services. The user is defining interfaces and classes for application monitoring and identity pool configurations, indicating a focus on setting up and managing AWS resources programmatically.
aiUseSummary: There is no evidence of AI tools being used in the provided screenshots. The user is primarily engaged in writing and managing code within the WebStorm IDE without any visible interaction with AI chat interfaces or other AI tools. The focus is on manual coding and dependency management.
